meanings.definition: Something that incites to action or exertion or quickens action, feeling, thought, etc.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was a stimulus for the dog to start barking.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a reward as a stimulus to encourage good behavior in class.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected dance party in the library provided a fun stimulus for the studious students.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring speech acted as a powerful stimulus, motivating everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies served as a delightful stimulus for memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: Something that excites an organism or part to functional activity.
meanings.sent1: The bright light served as a stimulus for the plant to grow towards it.
meanings.sent2: The delicious scent of food can be a strong stimulus for hunger.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became a playful stimulus for the grumpy old cat.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the starting gun acted as a powerful stimulus, triggering the sprinters to race.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the finish line served as a motivating stimulus for the exhausted marathon runner.
